input_str: Ten orange adult aphids were placed each day at 8°C for five months before we obtained a viable and robust colony of green variants (figure 1). By chance, progenies of the orange adult aphids did not survive at 8°C. Most larvae died from larval stage 1 to stage 4. Cold (8°C) conditions successfully selected a viable and robust green aphid lineage from orange descendants of a 22°C-adapted unique founder mother. Importantly, the switch to
